content:
• Wednesday, April 25, 2012
  • TER

    More on Teradyne (NYSE:TER): Q1 beats estimates across the board on strong sales of...

    More on Teradyne (NYSE:TER): Q1 beats estimates across the board on strong sales of high-performance mobile devices. The company also guides Q2 higher, now expecting to earn $0.53 - $0.62 on revenue of $490M - $530M. Shares +6.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 PM
  • EQIX

    More on Equinix's Q1: In spite of positive earnings, free cash flow was -$19.5M, as the company...

    More on Equinix's Q1: In spite of positive earnings, free cash flow was -$19.5M, as the company keeps investing aggressively to expand its data center footprint. Plans for a new South Florida data center are being announced today. Equinix is guiding for Q2 revenue of $466M-$468M and 2012 revenue of  "greater than $1.89B," compared with a consensus of $463.3M and $1.89B. EQIX +9.5% AH. RAX +1.5%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) -2.3% AH as Bloomberg reports the company is seeking buyers for several of...

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) -2.3% AH as Bloomberg reports the company is seeking buyers for several of its thermal-coal mines in the U.S., which together may fetch $600M or more. First-round bids for the mines, located in Kentucky, Illinois and Utah, are expected to come in late next month.

  • ENVI

    After pricing its 7.75M-share IPO at $9, Envivio (NASDAQ:ENVI) had an unimpressive opening day,...

    After pricing its 7.75M-share IPO at $9, Envivio (NASDAQ:ENVI) had an unimpressive opening day, falling 5.7% to $8.49. Envivio, a developer of video-processing hardware and software for enabling "TV Everywhere" deployments, ended the day with a market cap of $226.3M. The company posted revenue of $50.6M (+69% Y/Y) and net income of $138K in the fiscal year ending Jan. 31. Time Warner Cable accounted for 18% of sales. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • MX

    Magnachip Semiconductor (NYSE:MX): Q1 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $177M (-5.8% Y/Y)...

    Magnachip Semiconductor (NYSE:MX): Q1 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $177M (-5.8% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +3.9% AH. (PR)

  • VIVHY

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is considering an overhaul of its company structure that may lead to a...

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is considering an overhaul of its company structure that may lead to a breakup, Bloomberg reports. One option is to split in two, with one part including media assets such as Universal Music and video-game maker Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI); the other would contain telecom and content distribution units. Shares spiked +7.7% before the close, +1.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • INFN

    Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN): Q1 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $104.7M (+12.7% Y/Y) misses...

    Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN): Q1 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $104.7M (+12.7% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)

  • CSCO

    More on Emulex's FQ3: EPS beat was driven by a doubling of sales of 10G Ethernet products,...

    More on Emulex's FQ3: EPS beat was driven by a doubling of sales of 10G Ethernet products, further evidence of strong demand in this market (a positive for CSCO) and possibly the impact of Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) Romley launch. Emulex is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $126M-$130M and EPS of $0.21-$0.23, compared with a consensus of $129.6M and $0.20. ELX +6.3% AH. QLogic (NASDAQ:QLGC) might rally tomorrow in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • PTC

    Parametric Technology (PMTC): Q1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $301M (+11.8% Y/Y)...

    Parametric Technology (PMTC): Q1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $301M (+11.8% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares -6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • CLF

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF): Q1 revenue grew by 7% Y/Y, driven by higher sales...

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF): Q1 revenue grew by 7% Y/Y, driven by higher sales volumes across all of the company's reporting segments. Global iron ore sales volume sets new production record of 8M tons, which was partially offset by higher expenses and lower sales prices. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • DTLK

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK): Q1 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.01. RevenPRue of $119M (+39% Y/Y) beats by...

    | 5:24 PM
  • INTC

    More on Xilinx's FQ4: Strong results were fueled by major rebounds in Industrial (+18% Q/Q) and...

    More on Xilinx's FQ4: Strong results were fueled by major rebounds in Industrial (+18% Q/Q) and Consumer & Automotive (+9%) sales. The chipmaker expresses confidence it will continue gaining FPGA share (presumably from ALTR) through FY13, with the help of new 28nm chips. Xilinx is guiding for FQ1 revenue of $564.5M-$587M, above a consensus of $552.6M. XLNX +7.7% AH. ALTR +1.3%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF): Q1 EPS of $2.63. Revenue of $1.3B (+7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

  • HRB

    H&R Block (NYSE:HRB) -16.3% AH after announcing plans to cut 350 jobs and close ~200...

    H&R Block (NYSE:HRB) -16.3% AH after announcing plans to cut 350 jobs and close ~200 company-owned offices as part of a realignment, expecting the move to save up to $100M by the end of FY 2013. HRB also says it is searching for a new CFO; current CFO Jeff Brown will remain on the job during the search process.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 8 Comments
  • AKAM

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for Q2 revenue of $322M-$330M and...

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for Q2 revenue of $322M-$330M and EPS of $0.36-$0.38; the former is above a consensus of $314.8M, but the latter is below a consensus of $0.39, and is raising new fears of strong price competition in the content delivery network (CDN) space. AKAM -7.4% AH. Rivals LLNW and LVLT could also be volatile in trading tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): Q1 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $559M (-4.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): Q1 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $559M (-4.9% Y/Y) beats by $28M. Shares +7.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTXS

    More on Citrix Systems' Q1: The company expects Q2 revenue of $605M-$615M and EPS of $0.58-$0.59...

    More on Citrix Systems' Q1: The company expects Q2 revenue of $605M-$615M and EPS of $0.58-$0.59 vs. a consensus of $603.4M and $0.63; sales investments are pressuring near-term EPS. Guidance for 2012 revenue of $2.53B-$2.56B and EPS of $2.75-$2.79 is above a consensus of $2.51B and $2.74. Deferred revenue reached $983M, +2% Q/Q and +25% Y/Y. Asia-Pac sales +40% Y/Y. CTXS +6.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • ISIL

    Intersil (NASDAQ:ISIL): Q1 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $156M (-21.6% Y/Y) in-line....

    | 4:58 PM
  • ACOM

    More on Ancestry.com: The company is also announcing a $100M stock buyback program, and guiding...

    More on Ancestry.com: The company is also announcing a $100M stock buyback program, and guiding for Q2 revenue of $115M-$117M ($116.5M consensus) and 2012 revenue of $460M-$470M ($461M consensus). Subscribers rose 10% Q/Q in Q1 to 1.87M, and are expected to reach 1.965M-1.98M at the end of Q2, and roughly remain at that level at year's end. ACOM +6.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • IDCC

  • ACOM

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +4.4%) +6.4% AH after reporting Q1 revenue of $108.5M (+19% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +4.4%) +6.4% AH after reporting Q1 revenue of $108.5M (+19% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.30, beating consensus by $1.1M and $0.07, and announcing it's spending $100M in cash and assumed liabilities to acquire fellow family history site Archives.com. Archives.com has over 380K paid subs, and Ancestry claims the site's focus on historical records makes it complementary to its own offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM

    Arris Group (NASDAQ:ARRS): Q1 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $302.9M (+13.3% Y/Y) beats...

  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS): FQ4 EPS of $0.36 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $110.6M (+17% Y/Y) beats...

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS): FQ4 EPS of $0.36 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $110.6M (+17% Y/Y) beats by $0.5M. Company expects FQ1 revenue of $96M-$106M, below consensus of $106.6M. Says revenue will be "sharply higher" in FQ2. CRUS +3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM): Q1 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $319.4M (+16% Y/Y) beats by...

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM): Q1 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $319.4M (+16% Y/Y) beats by $8.7M. New $150M share repurchase program authorized to offset equity dilution. CEO Paul Sagan plans to depart by the end of 2013. Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • NOV

    National Oilwell Varco's (NOV -1.8%) Q1 earnings rose an above-consensus 49% on broad growth in...

    National Oilwell Varco's (NOV -1.8%) Q1 earnings rose an above-consensus 49% on broad growth in all of the company's main business segments, but shares fell as profit margins at its rig technology unit were thinner than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • LVS

    Shares of Las Vegas Sands (LVS +4.2%) rally in front of its earnings report slated to be...

    Shares of Las Vegas Sands (LVS +4.2%) rally in front of its earnings report slated to be released after the market closes. While analysts have trended higher with revenue estimates for Q1 over the last month, they will also be closely watching for an early report on the progress of its latest Macau casino and to hear more about the mega-sized gambling project planned for Spain.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD -2.6%) sells off yet again on the release of a Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) algorithm...

    Demand Media (DMD -2.6%) sells off yet again on the release of a Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) algorithm change (previous). Google's Webspam update, which the search giant says will affect 3.1% of English queries, has produced lower SEO visibility for a number of well-known sites (as well as higher visibility for others). It's not hard to imagine some of Demand Media's content-farming sites being among the losers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • WBSN

    As part of reporting in-line Q1 results, Websense (WBSN +4.5%) says it agrees to settle an...

    As part of reporting in-line Q1 results, Websense (WBSN +4.5%) says it agrees to settle an outstanding dispute with the IRS relating to an audit of its 2005-2007 tax years. WBSN will pay $10M in federal tax plus $5M-$6M in state taxes and interest; it sees $4M in future tax benefits. The original amount of additional tax proposed by the IRS was $19M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • HOG

    UBS issues cautious comments on Harley Davidson (HOG +5.9%) despite the motorcyle maker's...

    UBS issues cautious comments on Harley Davidson (HOG +5.9%) despite the motorcyle maker's seemingly strong Q1 report and subsequent rally. Analysts with the firm warn that the company shipped everything they produced during the period and dealer inventory trended higher despite the strong sales numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • EW

    Canaccord weighs in on Edwards Lifesciences (EW +11.3%) after a stellar Q1 result, recommending...

    Canaccord weighs in on Edwards Lifesciences (EW +11.3%) after a stellar Q1 result, recommending investors buy the shares ahead of a few catalysts, including an NCD final decision expected in early May and a Cohort-A Panel in mid-June.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • SLAB

    The selloff in Silicon Labs (SLAB -17.2%) is attributed to hints the company may exit one of its...

    The selloff in Silicon Labs (SLAB -17.2%) is attributed to hints the company may exit one of its biggest growth plays. SLAB says it is looking at its touch controllers for smartphones "through a strategic lens," citing increased competition in Asia. While sales volume for the market is attractive, the associated costs may be growing too big, CEO Tyson Tuttle warns.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • PRST

    Presstek (PRST +7.7%) pops after saying it's sold one of its 75DI digital offset presses to a...

    Presstek (PRST +7.7%) pops after saying it's sold one of its 75DI digital offset presses to a large North America based packaging converter. The order is one of the largest the company has posted to date.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • CBI

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +1.1%) gains despite posting a Q1 result that missed estimates...

    Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +1.1%) gains despite posting a Q1 result that missed estimates yesterday. Net earnings actually rose 18% Y/Y, led by growth at its project engineering and construction business. UBS' Steven Fisher says the quarter was hurt by lower than expected Steel Plate revenue and Lummus Tech income plus higher SG&A, but margins were better than expected and revenues should ramp up going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • HES

    Hess (HES -7.2%), today's worst S&P 500 performer, continues to slide after the company said...

    Hess (HES -7.2%), today's worst S&P 500 performer, continues to slide after the company said it won't meet its production target from the Bakken shale field. "Progress in the Bakken has been the key underpinning for optimism of a turnaround," Credit Suisse writes, adding Hess is "drilling certain acreage to capture leases as opposed to focusing just on the sweet spots."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • BMY

    Carl Icahn withdraws his lawsuit against Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +3.5%) following...

    Carl Icahn withdraws his lawsuit against Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +3.5%) following “discussions” with CEO Daniel Bradbury “that we agreed would not be publicly disclosed.” Though Icahn's terse statement is open to interpretation, it seems likely that AMLN is exploring a sale on its own, just as Icahn wants.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • SLAB

    On a good day for chip stocks (SOXX +1.9%), Silicon Labs (SLAB -14.4%) is a very notable...

    On a good day for chip stocks (SOXX +1.9%), Silicon Labs (SLAB -14.4%) is a very notable exception. The selloff is occurring even though the company's Q1 results beat estimates, and its guidance for Q2 revenue of $129.5M-$134.5M is largely above a $129.7M consensus. Shares were already underperforming in 2012 after rallying last fall.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • TKR

    Specialty steel manufacturer Timken (TKR +7.4%) gains after its Q1 beats across the board on...

    Specialty steel manufacturer Timken (TKR +7.4%) gains after its Q1 beats across the board on double-digit growth in earnings and revenue. The company posted solid profit from all major segments, and raises its FY12 guidance to a range of $6.10 - $6.40 per share, with sales estimates rising 7% - 10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • DAL

    High fuel prices dented results at Delta Air Lines (DAL -0.6%) and US Airways (LCC +3.2%),...

    High fuel prices dented results at Delta Air Lines (DAL -0.6%) and US Airways (LCC +3.2%), which suffered ~14% increases in basic fuel prices and were only modestly able to push up fares and revenues. But DAL believes it will be “solidly profitable” over the full year “despite higher fuel prices," and LCC says it is "encouraged with the overall strength in passenger demand."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (SFLY +4.9%) outperforms after announcing there were no competing offers to its...

    Shutterfly (SFLY +4.9%) outperforms after announcing there were no competing offers to its $23.8M bid to buy Kodak Gallery from bankrupt Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK). Kodak Gallery has 75M users, and stands to both strengthen Shutterfly's position in the online photo printing market, and expand its presence in the only photo gallery space, as fears grow about a decline in photo printing.
